content: the saturna headband knitting pattern roseandpurl com notes the saturna headband details abbreviations method knitting in inches skill level beginner/intermediate k knit p purl needles knitting needles st s stitch es 10mm / us 15 c6f cable 6 front slip 3 stitches onto cable needle and hold at front of other cable needle work k3 stitches from left needle k yarn needle 3 stitches from cable needle c6b cable 6 back slip 3 stitches onto yarn super bulky 6 - 60 yards cable needle and hold at back of *see page 4 for yarn suggestions work k3 stitches from left needle k 3 stitches from cable needle gauge 4 x 4 = 11 sts x 12 row pattern the saturna headband note this headband is worked flat and seamed together directions are for womens size cast on 13 sts row 1 k2 p9 k2 row 2 k13 row 3 k2 p9 k2 row 4 k2 c6f k5 row 5 k2 p9 k2 row 6 k13 row 7 k2 p9 k2 row 8 k5 c6b k2 repeat row 1-8 until your headband is 18 long about 7 times - you should have 8 complete braids you can also test how many braids you need by checking how it fits on your head as you go - you may need to add an extra row of braid or you may need one less cast off leaving a 14 tail seam your two ends together and weave in your ends © 2018 roseandpurl com all rights reserved it is illegal to redistribute sell or share the pattern in part or in whole electronically or physically we are knitters - the wool lion brand wool ease thick & quick about handmade modern knits and faux fur pom poms made with love on vancouver island the use of pattern/photos for resale purposes is prohibited however you are encouraged to sell the finished product please give credit to this pattern on all finished items please link tag promote @roseandpurl or #roseandpurl #saturnaheadband please do not copy or share pattern details the pattern and photos are property of rose&purl and may not be altered or sold thank you contact @roseandpurl roseandpurl com stacey@roseandpurl com
